title: URF and Breaking Recalls...
body: Can Riot like, code Anivia's walls and Trundle's poles etc not to break ally recalls? Displacement is fine but not recalls...

replies.body: It would be easier for displacements to not move allies.

> [{quoted}](name=Arcanopulse,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=Qhi9XeFz,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2015-04-08T02:15:49.116+0000)
>
> It would be easier for displacements to not move allies.

But that would defeat the purpose of Anivia's wall, Trundle Pole and Jarvan IV ult...

...or it would open up mechanics some players might not want

I don't know what planet you are from, but here on Earth Anivia's wall was not primarily designed to displace team mates.

> [{quoted}](name=Arcanopulse,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=Qhi9XeFz,comment-id=000200000000,timestamp=2015-04-08T07:20:36.837+0000)
>
> I don't know what planet you are from, but here on Earth Anivia's wall was not primarily designed to displace team mates.

Well I dunno, I don't play Anivia, but it might be more of a buff if they made it "not displace team mates". Riot must have a reason for making it that way so I won't attack it. Not now anyway

But displacements cancel recalls. 
You can't have one and not  the other. 
It no work like that.
Ally displacements should not. It will still move you, but your recall continues as it is.

I know what your asking for. 
Just that would involve recoding.

It is how it is.
